details.content: The 48-hour nation-wide general strike called by various trade unions in protest against the Centre's anti-labour policies affected normal life in Kerala.

details.title: Trains delayed due to Trade Union strike
details.content: The agitators blocked train services in various railway stations including Thiruvananthapuram and Alappuzha, delaying the services of Jana Sadabdi Express, Raptisagar Express, Venad Express, Dhanbad Express, Eranad Express and several other trains.

#Kerala: 48-hour nationwide strike called by Central Trade Unions demanding minimum wages, social security schemes & against privatisation of public and government sector; Visuals from Kochi (pic1&2) and Trivandrum (pic 3) pic.twitter.com/cuKkicTzJW

— ANI (@ANI) January 8, 2019
Schools and colleges across several parts of Karnataka remain closed on Tuesday in support of the Bharat Bandh called by several trade unions. (Read here)

details.title: Incidents of vandalism reported in parts of West Bengal
details.content: Stones were pelted at a school bus in Champadali area of Barasat in North 24 Parganas district. A government bus was also ransacked by strike supporters. (Read here)

West Bengal: Clash between TMC and CPM workers in Asansol during 48-hour nationwide strike called by Central Trade Unions demanding minimum wages, social security schemes & against privatisation of public and government sector. pic.twitter.com/5oM6TWxnx7

— ANI (@ANI) January 8, 2019

details.title: Members of CITU union march towards Indira park in Telangana
details.content:
#BharatBandh #Telangana commences with members of #CITU chanting slogans marching towards Indira Park #Hyderabad .@NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/0ni5RA3EL6

— Apoorva Jayachandran (@Jay_Apoorva18) January 8, 2019

details.title: Mumbai commuters face trouble
details.content: Commuters plying in buses in Mumbai are facing trouble after the BEST employees decided to go on an indefinite strike from Monday night against the inaction of the authorities towards fulfilling their demands. (Read here)

#Mumbai: BEST (Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport) have begun an indefinite strike from Monday midnight, over the demands of implementation of the merger of the BEST budget with principal budget of the BMC, employee service residences and recruitment among others.. pic.twitter.com/DgPprAHGkM

— ANI (@ANI) January 8, 2019

MUMBAI: 40 extra buses being run by state transport department in the view of an indefinite strike by BEST over demands of implementation of the merger of the BEST budget with principal budget of the BMC, employee service residences etc
CITU JCTU Workers protest at Penya during Bharath Bandh in Bengaluru (Photo | Nagaraja Gadekl/EPS)

details.title: Sporadic incidents reported in West Bengal
details.content: Stones were pelted at a school bus in Champadali area of Barasat in North 24 Parganas district. A government bus was also ransacked by strike supporters at Champadali. Protestors also vandalised a bus at Jamuria in Paschim Bardhaman district.(Read here)

details.title: The working class of India will give a fitting answer to anti worker, anti people policies of the government: CPI(M)
details.content:
#Nationalstrike2019

Say no to Anti people, anti worker policies of the Modi Govt pic.twitter.com/PXdX3Napvn

— CPI (M) (@cpimspeak) January 7, 2019

details.title: Banking operations partially affected in some parts of country
details.content: All India Bank Employees' Association (AIBEA) and Bank Employees' Federation of India (BEFI) have supported the strike, which has impacted banking operation where these two unions are strong. (Read here)

details.title: Enough is enough, no bandh in Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
details.content: "In the last 34 years, Left Front have destroyed the state by calling bandh. There will be no bandh," West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said. (Read here)
Trade union workers blocking vehicles at National Highway at Kazhakkoottam in Thiruvananthapuram during Nation wide 48 hours General strike on Tuesday. Express photo by BP Deepu. (View more here)
Trade union workers blocking vehicles at National Highway at Kazhakkoottam in Thiruvananthapuram during nationwide strike on Tuesday. Express photo by BP Deepu. (View more here)

details.title: WATCH | Trade union members raise slogans against central government
details.content:
#BharatBandh | Scores of trade unions across the nation are on a two-day #nationwidestrike to protest against the @narendramodi-led government's alleged anti-worker policies and unilateral labour reforms.
For LIVE updates: https://t.co/ZMT7TvZltZ pic.twitter.com/mnf4QAsZ9J

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) January 8, 2019
More than 20 lakh employees and workers of public, private and unorganised sectors in Telangana are expected to participate in the nationwide strike. (Read here)

details.title: Vehicular movement affected in National Highway in Bhubaneswar
details.content:
Vehicular movement has come to a grinding halt on NH-16 in #Bhubanewar due to #tradeunionsstrike #BharatBandh @NewIndianXpress@Siba_TNIE pic.twitter.com/V8NmgHJVsX

— Sudarsan Maharana (@Sud_TNIE) January 8, 2019

The ruling BJD and opposition Congress have extended their support to the nationwide strike in Odisha. Commuters face tough time finding buses and auto-rickshaws in several cities as protesters staged road blockade at various places. (Read here)
Government offices, banks affected in Maharashtra due to the trade union strike. (Read here)

details.title: Hyderabad stays unaffected by the nationwide strike called by trade unions. (Express photo | S Senbagapandiyan)

details.content: Banking operations partially hit in Tamil Nadu as a section of bank employees protest in support of the trade union strike. (Read here)

#GeneralStrike Shops, hotels and pvt offices functioning normal in Kochi. No violence so far reported. Only Public transport system affected with KSRTC, union afflliated private buses staying off the roads.

— ajay kanth (@ajaykanth7) January 8, 2019

#RTC Telangana Muzdoor Union TMU workers protesting during lunch outside depots in the city. Constituiting 90% of the @TSRTCHQ workers, TMU members decided to continue services throughthe day, only taking part in the strike during Lunch. #Hyderabad #BharatBandh @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/eBbL3MdWrp

— Apoorva Jayachandran (@Jay_Apoorva18) January 8, 2019

details.title: Normal life crippled as shops and business establishments shut in Odisha
details.content: Rail roko staged by trade union members and bandh supporters affected train services in many parts of the state including Bhubaneswar, Cuttack, Balasore, Bhadrak, Sambalpur, Berhampur, Puri and Paradip. Normal life was crippled as shops at major markets, and business establishments downed their shutters.

details.title: INTUC members protest inside Maidan metro station in Kolkata
details.content:
West Bengal: Members of the Indian National Trade Union Congress (INTUC) protest inside Maidan metro station in Kolkata in support of the two-day nationwide strike called by Central Trade Unions demanding minimum wages and social security schemes among others. pic.twitter.com/NkihQZRb0M

— ANI (@ANI) January 8, 2019

details.title: Tripura witness partial response to the All India strike
details.content: Vehicles were seen plying on roads in the state capital like any other day and banks and financial institutions were mostly open. (Read here)
